pageContext.claim: “They were you -- as you know, we said, took over the Police Department, took over the precinct. That -- they took it over. Everybody -- the cops were running. Those cops don't run. They were told to leave. They should never happen. That was a horrible signal, super liberal mayor. He was crying. He was crying.”
pageContext.analysis: The Minneapolis police did make an unprecedented decision to abandon the 3rd Precinct building on the night of May 28 during riots over the killing of George Floyd. It was described as a tactical retreat, and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) ordered the National Guard to reclaim the building the next day. During the rioting, Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey (D) made several emotional pleas calling for peaceful demonstrations but he did not cry, as Trump claims. At a memorial service for Floyd, Frey was seen crying as he knelt beside the casket.
